intro: Echium nervosum var. laxiflorum, commonly known as the laxiflorous thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its tall, spiny stems and clusters of violet-blue flowers. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its striking appearance. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats.
